main.name: Vince Estrada
main.description: I have a passion for design and I love to build beautiful and responsive user interfaces. I have experience with React, Node/Express, Sequelize, and PostgreSQL. I'm looking to expand my experience in building and scaling web applications and services in all domains. I'm passionate about open-source contributions, working in high-impact environments, and contributing to development teams to help build a great product
main.bio: I am a gamer at heart, with an entrepreneurial spirit, a knack for visual arts, and a passion for coding. Born in a small town in Central Philippines, I made my move to the United States where I now work as an MRI technologist still searching for their first developer opportunity. I love to create and tend to take on too many hobbies and projects at any one time. Outside of work I am an avid kayak fisherman, competitive gamer and amateur cook. I love to travel but lead a fairly quiet lifestyle. I have this dream that I will be able to take my work with me on a secluded body of water - just me, my laptop, and my dog all on my kayak.
main.contactmessage: Reach out to me through any of my links below

resume.skillmessage: Everyday I become more skilled at implementing these technologies. The grind never stops and while I still have much to learn, I am confident in the foundational knowledge that I currently have.

education.degree: Full-time remote immersive software engineering program
education.description: Fullstack laid down the groundwork for me to build web applications from the bottom up. I was given the confidence to learn anything new that will be thrown at me using Google, documentation, and the wisdom of other developers.

education.degree: Applied Sciences with focus in Magnetic Resonance Imaging
education.description: I was given the tools to become the hardworking individual I am today. This program shaped me to have the skills and attitude to become an excellent practitioner who provides consistent service and care to a community.

work.company: Ann & Robert H. Lurie Children's Hospital of Chicago
work.title: Senior MRI Technologist
work.description: Here I learned how to skillfully handle the constant flow of tasks to be done by myself and coworkers. I was able to hone critical thinking skills assisting with my developing abilities in software engineering. I have successfully been serving as an interim lead technologist adding to my responsibilities on top of my obligation as a staff technologist.

work.title: Student experience
work.description: Curriculum was designed with project-based learning in mind. Labs and workshops were a collaborative effort to simulate the day-to-day life of a software engineer working in a growing development team.

testimonials.text: He's just the best... at everything. Such a hard worker - so handsome too!
